info.name: 05_managers
info.description:
configure various bmc settings

possible action items/usage:
- set date and time, NTP servers
- get BMC ip/network settings
- configure host interface
- perform bmc unit reset
- perform factory default
- check maintenance event log
- check mounted devices, mount/unmount virtual media
- configure and get IKVM link
- configure RADIUS, syslog
- configure ip access/filter rules
- configure fan mode, mouse mode
- configure smcrakp, kcs privilege
- license management
- enable system lockdown
- check POST code

related uris:
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Actions/Manager.Reset
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Actions/Oem/SmcManagerConfig.Reset
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/ResetActionInfo
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/SerialInterfaces
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/SerialInterfaces/[service_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1/Actions/LogService.ClearLog
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1/Entries 
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1/Entries/[log_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]          
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]/Actions/VirtualMedia.InsertMedia
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]/InsertMediaActionInfo
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]/Actions/VirtualMedia.EjectMedia
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/Floppy[mounted_dev_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/EthernetInterfaces
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/EthernetInterfaces/[eth_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/EthernetInterfaces/ToHost
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/HostInterfaces
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/HostInterfaces/1
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/HostInterfaces/1/HostEthernetInterfaces
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol/HTTPS/Certificates
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol/HTTPS/Certificates/1
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol/HTTPS/Certificates/1/Actions/Certificate.Rekey
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol/HTTPS/Certificates/1/RekeyActionInfo
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol/HTTPS/Certificates/1/Actions/Certificate.Renew
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/FanMode
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/MouseMode
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/Snooping
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/Syslog
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/RADIUS
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/SMCRAKP
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/IPAccessControl
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/IPAccessControl/FilterRules
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/IPAccessControl/FilterRules/[rule_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/NTP
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/IKVM

item.name: bmc network configuration

request.description: - array of links to bmc ip configuration + host interface

- services enabled
- which port used for each service
- ports:
    - HTTP/S
    - IPMI
    - SNMP
    - SSH
    - NTP
    - Virtual Media
    - KVMIP
    - SSDP

- modify "SSH" to desired port
- ProtocolEnabled = bool (true/false)

- modify "SSH" to desired port
- Port = int within valid port range
- make sure port to change to is not already occupied/used

- modify the two array elements under NTPServers as desired
- note if NTP sync fails, NTP service will automatically disable
- also linked from CertificateLocations

- modify KeyBitLength as desired (can remove)
    - 1024
    - 2048
    - 3072
    - 4096
- generates a certificate signing request

item.description:
- bmc ip info (ipv4, ipv6 settings)
- service port : enable/disable, change port info
- host interface info

item.name: fan mode

request.description:
- current setting
- shows allowable configurable modes
- modify Mode as desired, value must be one of the values in Mode@Redfish.AllowableValues

item.description:
- get/set fan mode
- allowable values provided in resource

request.description:
- modify the following as desired
    - RadiusEnabled: bool
    - RadiusServer: ipv4/ipv6/domain name
    - RadiusPortNumber: int in valid port range
    - RadiusSecret: string

item.name: ikvm

request.description:
- get current ikvm interface (HTML5 or java)
- if current interface is HTML5, a link will be included in the response; this can be used to open an ikvm console

- modify Current interface as desired
    - "HTML 5"
    - "JAVA plug-in"
- spaces are needed to work

item.description:
- get/set HTML5 or Java console
- get HTML5 ikvm link

item.name: IP access control

request.description: - enable/disable the service here
- value is type bool (true=enabled)
- array of all configured filter rules
- modify Address and PrefixLength as desired
- modify Address and PrefixLength as desired

- **sample location**
- FilterRules/[num] depends on which filter to delete

item.description:
- enable/disable ip access control
- add/remove filter rules
- note can create two filter rules for the same address but different policy, but the one created first takes precedence

request.description:
- modify value for Privilege as desired
    - Administrator / Operator / User

item.name: license management

request.description: link to various actions that can be performed regarding licenses
- **sample payload only**

- **sample payload**
- modify value for LicenseID for license to remove (can be found in QueryLicense.Licenses, each license type has its own id)
- type = string
- 1 = OOB, 2 = DCMS

item.description:
- query license
- activate license
- delete license

request.description: - settings and configuration for MEL
- default MEL is enabled
- array of MEL entries, links to specific entries

- shows current mode
- shows all possible configurable modes
- modify value for Mode to one of Absolute, Relative, Single as desired

item.name: NTP

request.description: - oem

- modify the following as desired
    - NTPEnable: bool
    - PrimaryNTPServer: ipv4/ipv6/domain name
    - SecondaryNTPServer: ipv4/ipv6/domain name
- value is type bool, modify as desired

item.description:
- set NTP servers
- set DaylightSaving
- OEM (redfish standard is in NetworkProtocol), changes will be synced

item.name: post code snooping

request.description: - read only

item.description:
- POST code snooping
- info reporting only

request.description:
- get current settings
- default Disabled
- modify Mode as desired (Enabled / Disabled)

item.name: SNMP configuration

request.description:
- settings for SNMP commands to BMC
- note SNMP accounts will be created in AccountService Accounts

- after PATCH will have 1 total community string
- modify CommunityString and Name as desired

- after PATCH will have 1 total community string
- modify CommunityString and Name as desired

- sample payload will create 1 limited access community string, and 1 full access community string
- modify CommunityString and Name as desired
- max community strings supported = 5 (i.e. max 5 array elements)
- value of true will hide CommunityString in CommunityStrings (changed to null when GET again)
- value of false will expose CommunityString in CommunityStrings (i.e any account with access to NetworkProtocol will be able to see the exact community strings configured)
- AuthenticationProtocol: Account and EncryptionProtocol: Account indicate Authentication/Encryption protocols should follow the ones defined in the SNMPv3 account

item.description:
- settings for SNMP commands to BMC
- note SNMPv3 accounts/usernames will be created in AccountService Accounts

item.name: syslog

request.description: - get syslog settings

- modify the following as desired
    - EnableSyslog: bool
    - SyslogServer: ipv4/ipv6/domain name
    - SyslogPortNumber: int, valid port range

item.description:
- enabled/disable syslog service
- configure syslog server + port

request.description:
- modify SysLockdownEnabled as desired
    - bool (true / false)

item.name: virtual media

request.description:
- default shows one link to CD1
- more links will appear as more devices are mounted
- max 3 devices, only 0 or 1 floppy device total
- redfish + web "share" one slot (i.e. if mount CD via web, cannot mount via redfish and vice versa)
- link will default exist
- more help on insert media parameters

- CD[num] in location depends on what is already mounted
- modify Image, UserName, Password as desired
- UserName and Password are optional (i.e. only need if share host requires them)

- no payload
- only available when a CD is already mounted

- location is **sample only** ("Floppy3"), Floppy[num] depends on where the floppy image is mounted
- currently cannot mount floppy via redfish, this link only appears if floppy already mounted via web/ikvm

item.description:
- insert CD
- eject CD
- note currently cannot mount floppy via redfish, but will show link if mounted via web/ikvm

request.description:
- links to various bmc configuration
- basic bmc config (ex. fw version, date/time)
- targets to perform bmc unit reset + factory default
- template provided for format; modify values as desired
- clears accounts, sets ADMIN password to unique password
- will preserve accounts, ADMIN password is preserved as well

item.name: perform factory default: reset to ADMIN

request.description: - clears accounts, sets ADMIN password to ADMIN
